page.title: 11BIBURY CHURCH AND CHAPEL
page.content: The church today, like many village churches, is not used to the extent that it was fifty years ago, apart from baptisms, weddings and funerals. It is very popular with visitors for its Saxon and Norman arcitecture and the beautiful rose trees lining the paths. The priest in charge lives in Bibury, and serves Bibury, Winson and Barnsley churches. There is mainly only one service on Sundays but there is a small but happy Sunday School. The Baptist Chapel is in Arlington near the Green. There is no longer a resident clergyman but regular Sunday services and women's meetings are held. The people who lead these groups and these services are from outside the village.
